bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Ruth V. Reed, March 22, 1930

div1.p: Carter thanks Reed for the assistance she has provided and asks Reed to supply correct names to be used in the bibliography of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Ruth V. Reed, March 22, 1930
div1.opener:
Book, Bibliography
Reed, Miss Ruth V.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
March 22, 1930.
My Dear Miss Reed:
div1.p:
Your most welcome and much appreciated letter of March 7th.,
would have been answered long since, but for a combination of work
and illness, about which it is not worth while to take up your time
with details.

Suffice it to say, I am very glad to get the extract from Dr.
Connor's letter in Brazil (re “aljibes” etc.) and am very grateful
to you and Dr. Russell for seeking this further information, as I am
sure Dr. Frost will be too.when

Will you do me yet another favor..i. e. give me the full
names of (a) Dr. M. E. Connor and (b) Dr. W. M. Monroe? We want
them for the completed Bibliography, in order to make it uniform.
With deepest appreciation of your kind help, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Laura A. Carter Miss Ruth V. Reed,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
P. S. I hope that Dr. Russell is still having the benefit of
a change of scene in Europe. Nobody could make him stop work!
L.A.C.
